result.markdown: --- title: "Merging rows" author: "Jeff Stevens" date: "2023-03-03" date-format: iso execute: echo: true freeze: true format: revealjs: theme: custom.scss slide-number: true code-line-numbers: false highlight-style: github code-overflow: wrap footer: "[DPaViR 2023](https://jeffreyrstevens.quarto.pub/dpavir)" code-link: true --- # Introduction ## The problem ::: {.cell} ::: What's different between these data sets? What is needed to create `data3` from `data1` and `data2`? :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="31%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 12 × 2 id resp 1 1 0.489 2 2 0.00965 3 3 0.214 4 4 0.148 5 5 0.535 6 6 0.528 7 7 0.952 8 8 0.0381 9 9 0.561 10 10 0.462 11 11 0.253 12 12 0.268 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="28%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 12 × 2 id cond 1 1 1 2 2 2 3 3 3 4 4 1 5 5 2 6 6 3 7 7 1 8 8 2 9 9 3 10 10 1 11 11 2 12 12 3 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data3 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 × 2 id resp 1 1 0.489 2 4 0.148 3 7 0.952 4 10 0.462 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Set-up ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(dplyr) library(nycflights13) (flights2 <- select(flights, year:dep_time, carrier, tailnum)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 336,776 × 6 year month day dep_time carrier tailnum 1 2013 1 1 517 UA N14228 2 2013 1 1 533 UA N24211 3 2013 1 1 542 AA N619AA 4 2013 1 1 544 B6 N804JB 5 2013 1 1 554 DL N668DN 6 2013 1 1 554 UA N39463 7 2013 1 1 555 B6 N516JB 8 2013 1 1 557 EV N829AS 9 2013 1 1 557 B6 N593JB 10 2013 1 1 558 AA N3ALAA # ℹ 336,766 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## Set-up ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(1) (airlines2 <- slice_sample(airlines, prop = 0.5)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 8 × 2 carrier name 1 HA Hawaiian Airlines Inc. 2 B6 JetBlue Airways 3 F9 Frontier Airlines Inc. 4 9E Endeavor Air Inc. 5 AA American Airlines Inc. 6 VX Virgin America 7 UA United Air Lines Inc. 8 AS Alaska Airlines Inc. ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} (airlines3 <- rename(airlines2, airline = carrier)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 8 × 2 airline name 1 HA Hawaiian Airlines Inc. 2 B6 JetBlue Airways 3 F9 Frontier Airlines Inc. 4 9E Endeavor Air Inc. 5 AA American Airlines Inc. 6 VX Virgin America 7 UA United Air Lines Inc. 8 AS Alaska Airlines Inc. ``` ::: ::: ## Joining with {dplyr} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(dplyr) ``` ::: ![](../images/joins_semi.gif){fig-align="center" width="45%"} ![](../images/dplyr_hex.png){.absolute width="15%" top="0%" left="95%"} ::: {.aside} Source: [Garrick Aden-Buie](https://github.com/gadenbuie/tidyexplain) ::: # Filtering joins ## Filtering joins #### Affect rows ![](../images/joins_semi.gif){fig-align="center" width="50%"} ## Semi joins #### Keep only matching observations ![](../images/join-semi.png){.absolute width="60%" top="35%" left="0%"} ![](../images/joins_semi.gif){.absolute width="40%" top="20%" left="65%"} ::: {.fragment} When is this useful? ::: ## Semi joins ![](../images/join-semi.png){.absolute width="30%" top="-10%" left="50%"} ::: {.cell} ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 key val_x 1 1 x1 2 2 x2 3 3 x3 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 key val_y 1 1 y1 2 2 y2 3 4 y3 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} semi_join(x, y, by = "key") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 2 key val_x 1 1 x1 2 2 x2 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Semi joins ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} airlines2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 8 × 2 carrier name 1 HA Hawaiian Airlines Inc. 2 B6 JetBlue Airways 3 F9 Frontier Airlines Inc. 4 9E Endeavor Air Inc. 5 AA American Airlines Inc. 6 VX Virgin America 7 UA United Air Lines Inc. 8 AS Alaska Airlines Inc. ``` ::: ::: ## Semi joins ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flights2 |> semi_join(airlines2, by = "carrier") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 171,392 × 6 year month day dep_time carrier tailnum 1 2013 1 1 517 UA N14228 2 2013 1 1 533 UA N24211 3 2013 1 1 542 AA N619AA 4 2013 1 1 544 B6 N804JB 5 2013 1 1 554 UA N39463 6 2013 1 1 555 B6 N516JB 7 2013 1 1 557 B6 N593JB 8 2013 1 1 558 AA N3ALAA 9 2013 1 1 558 B6 N793JB 10 2013 1 1 558 B6 N657JB # ℹ 171,382 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## Anti joins #### Keep only non-matching observations ![](../images/join-anti.png){.absolute width="60%" top="35%" left="0%"} ![](../images/joins_anti.gif){.absolute width="40%" top="20%" left="65%"} ::: {.fragment} When is this useful? ::: --- ## Anti joins ![](../images/join-anti.png){.absolute width="30%" top="-10%" left="50%"} ::: {.cell} ::: :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} x ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 key val_x 1 1 x1 2 2 x2 3 3 x3 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} y ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 key val_y 1 1 y1 2 2 y2 3 4 y3 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} anti_join(x, y, by = "key") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 × 2 key val_x 1 3 x3 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Anti joins ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flights2 |> anti_join(airlines2, by = "carrier") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 165,384 × 6 year month day dep_time carrier tailnum 1 2013 1 1 554 DL N668DN 2 2013 1 1 557 EV N829AS 3 2013 1 1 600 MQ N542MQ 4 2013 1 1 602 DL N971DL 5 2013 1 1 602 MQ N730MQ 6 2013 1 1 606 DL N3739P 7 2013 1 1 608 MQ N9EAMQ 8 2013 1 1 615 DL N326NB 9 2013 1 1 622 US N807AW 10 2013 1 1 624 EV N11107 # ℹ 165,374 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## Joining with different key names :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="60%"} ::: {style="font-size:90%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flights2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 336,776 × 6 year month day dep_time carrier tailnum 1 2013 1 1 517 UA N14228 2 2013 1 1 533 UA N24211 3 2013 1 1 542 AA N619AA 4 2013 1 1 544 B6 N804JB 5 2013 1 1 554 DL N668DN 6 2013 1 1 554 UA N39463 7 2013 1 1 555 B6 N516JB 8 2013 1 1 557 EV N829AS 9 2013 1 1 557 B6 N593JB 10 2013 1 1 558 AA N3ALAA # ℹ 336,766 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {style="font-size:90%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} airlines3 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 8 × 2 airline name 1 HA Hawaiian Airlines Inc. 2 B6 JetBlue Airways 3 F9 Frontier Airlines Inc. 4 9E Endeavor Air Inc. 5 AA American Airlines Inc. 6 VX Virgin America 7 UA United Air Lines Inc. 8 AS Alaska Airlines Inc. ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Joining with different key names ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} flights2 |> anti_join(airlines3, by = join_by(carrier == airline)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 165,384 × 6 year month day dep_time carrier tailnum 1 2013 1 1 554 DL N668DN 2 2013 1 1 557 EV N829AS 3 2013 1 1 600 MQ N542MQ 4 2013 1 1 602 DL N971DL 5 2013 1 1 602 MQ N730MQ 6 2013 1 1 606 DL N3739P 7 2013 1 1 608 MQ N9EAMQ 8 2013 1 1 615 DL N326NB 9 2013 1 1 622 US N807AW 10 2013 1 1 624 EV N11107 # ℹ 165,374 more rows ``` ::: ::: # Binding rows and columns ## Adding rows `tibble::add_row()` :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} (df <- tibble(x = 1:3, y = 3:1)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 x y 1 1 3 2 2 2 3 3 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df %>% add_row(x = 4, y = 0) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 × 2 x y 1 1 3 2 2 2 3 3 1 4 4 0 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df %>% add_row(x = 4, y = 0, .before = 2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 × 2 x y 1 1 3 2 4 0 3 2 2 4 3 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df %>% add_row(x = 4:5, y = 0:-1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 × 2 x y 1 1 3 2 2 2 3 3 1 4 4 0 5 5 -1 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Adding columns `tibble::add_column()` :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} (df <- tibble(x = 1:3, y = 3:1)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 x y 1 1 3 2 2 2 3 3 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df %>% add_column(z = 4:6) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 3 x y z 1 1 3 4 2 2 2 5 3 3 1 6 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df %>% add_column(w = 4:6, .before = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 3 w x y 1 4 1 3 2 5 2 2 3 6 3 1 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df %>% add_column(z = 4:6, alpha = 0) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 4 x y z alpha 1 1 3 4 0 2 2 2 5 0 3 3 1 6 0 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: :::: --- ## Combine data frames by rows `dplyr::bind_rows()` :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} (df2 <- tibble(x = 4:5, y = 5:4)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 2 x y 1 4 5 2 5 4 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} bind_rows(df, df2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 × 2 x y 1 1 3 2 2 2 3 3 1 4 4 5 5 5 4 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} (df3 <- tibble(x = 6:7, y = 7:6, z = c("A", "B"))) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 2 × 3 x y z 1 6 7 A 2 7 6 B ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} bind_rows(df, df3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 × 3 x y z 1 1 3 2 2 2 3 3 1 4 6 7 A 5 7 6 B ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: :::: --- ## Combine data frames by columns `dplyr::bind_cols()` :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} (df4 <- tibble(z = c("A", "B" , "C"), zz = c("Z", "Y", "X"))) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 2 z zz 1 A Z 2 B Y 3 C X ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} bind_cols(df, df4) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 4 x y z zz 1 1 3 A Z 2 2 2 B Y 3 3 1 C X ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} bind_cols(df, new_col = df4$z) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 3 x y new_col 1 1 3 A 2 2 2 B 3 3 1 C ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ::: {.fragment} But why is this dangerous? What is a better solution? ::: # Set operations ## Set operations #### For finding overlap, differences, and combinations of datasets ![](../images/setop_df.png){fig-align="center" width="40%"} ## Intersect Common rows in both `x` and `y`, keeping just unique rows ![](../images/setop_df.png){.absolute width="40%" top="28%" left="5%"} ![](../images/setop_intersect.gif){.absolute width="40%" top="20%" left="50%"} ## Set difference All rows from `x` which are not also rows in `y`, keeping just unique rows ![](../images/setop_df.png){.absolute width="40%" top="28%" left="5%"} ![](../images/setop_setdiff.gif){.absolute width="40%" top="20%" left="50%"} ## Union All unique rows from `x` and `y` ![](../images/setop_df.png){.absolute width="40%" top="28%" left="5%"} ![](../images/setop_union.gif){.absolute width="40%" top="28%" left="50%"} ## Union all All rows from `x` and `y`, keeping duplicates ![](../images/setop_df.png){.absolute width="40%" top="28%" left="5%"} ![](../images/setop_union-all.gif){.absolute width="40%" top="28%" left="50%"} ## SQL Congratulations---you just learned SQL databases! ![](../images/sql_joins.png){.absolute height="70%" top="22%" left="0%"} ![](../images/sql_setop.png){.absolute height="70%" top="22%" left="50%"} ## Solving the problem What code combines `data1` and `data2` into `data3`? :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="31%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data1 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 12 × 2 id resp 1 1 0.489 2 2 0.00965 3 3 0.214 4 4 0.148 5 5 0.535 6 6 0.528 7 7 0.952 8 8 0.0381 9 9 0.561 10 10 0.462 11 11 0.253 12 12 0.268 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="28%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data2 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 12 × 2 id cond 1 1 1 2 2 2 3 3 3 4 4 1 5 5 2 6 6 3 7 7 1 8 8 2 9 9 3 10 10 1 11 11 2 12 12 3 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column width="40%"} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} data3 ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 × 2 id resp 1 1 0.489 2 4 0.148 3 7 0.952 4 10 0.462 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Let's code! [Merging rows](../code/18_mergingrows.html){target="_blank"} [[Rmd](../code/18_mergingrows.Rmd){target="_blank"}]

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
